blocks.text: This Dashboard focuses on the level of automation in a standard Order-to-Cash (OTC) process. This breakdown can be used to identify process automation potential.
Structure of the Dashboard
Page 1 - Overview: Leading KPIs, a Process Discovery Widget and a Total Cost Estimation of Manual Posting Item Creation.
Page 2 - Impact: Overview of automated vs manual events in the current data set, Automation Recommender, Automation by Plant, RPA Bots and Company.
Page 3 - Root Causes: Deep Dive into drivers of the process bottlenecks and action proposals.
Page 4 - Take Action: Offers a summary of different recommendations based on the degree of automation.
Page 5 - Case Details: An exportable list of individual cases and their most important attributes that can be filtered.
Please see our Dashboard Documentation for more information on how to manage your dashboards.
Kindly provide feedback on the Dashboard, this will aid us in enhancing its functionality.

children.name: Calculation of automated and manual events

blocks.text:
Considered attribute (event Level): 
In the Dashboard, manual and automated events are included. This calculation is based on the event level attribute  EventCreatedByUserType.

Calculation and meaning of values:
The value of the attribute EventCreatedByUserType can either be dialog, which indicates a manual event, or system /service which indicates an automated event. If neither of them is available or defined, it is considered a NULL value which is excluded from calculations regarding automation rates the type of performance for that event is not defined. However, NULL values are included in the calculation of total events. So the calculation is:  total events = automated events + manual events + events with NULL values.
Manual Events =  EventCreatedByUserType => dialog
Automated Events = EventCreatedByUserType => System or Service

children.name: Automation Rate Overall
children.description: Percentage of all events performed by System or as an automated Service

children.name: Automation Rate Overall over Time
children.description: Percentage of automated events over time

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  DATE_TRUNC('month', end_time) AS "Event Date",
  COUNT ("event_name") FILTER (
    WHERE
      BEHAVIOUR (
        "EventCreatedByUserType" IN ('System', 'Service')
      ) AS automated MATCHES (automated)
  ) / COUNT ("event_name") FILTER (
          WHERE
            "EventCreatedByUserType" IS NOT NULL) * 100 AS "Automation Rate"
FROM
  FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS)
ORDER BY
  1 ASC NULLS FIRST FILL TIMESERIES('month'),
  NULL

children.name: Automation Rate of Invoice Events
children.description: Automation Percentage of all Invoice events

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  SUM(
    (
      SELECT
        COUNT("case_id") FILTER (
          WHERE
            (
              "EventCreatedByUserType" IN ('System', 'Service')
              AND (
                event_name LIKE '%Create Invoice%'
                OR event_name LIKE '%Create Pro Forma Invoice%'
                OR event_name LIKE '%Create Credit Memo%'
                OR event_name LIKE '%Create Debit Memo%'
                OR event_name LIKE '%Create Invoice Cancellation%'
                OR event_name LIKE '%Create Memo Cancellation%'
                OR event_name LIKE '%Post Credit Memo%'
                OR event_name LIKE '%Post Reverse Invoice%'
                OR event_name LIKE '%Post Incoming Payment%'
                OR event_name LIKE '%Post Invoice%'                
                OR event_name LIKE '%Clear Invoice%'
              )
            )
        )
    )
  ) / SUM(
    (
      SELECT
        COUNT("case_id") FILTER (
          WHERE
                event_name LIKE '%Create Invoice%'
                OR event_name LIKE '%Create Pro Forma Invoice%'
                OR event_name LIKE '%Create Credit Memo%'
                OR event_name LIKE '%Create Debit Memo%'
                OR event_name LIKE '%Create Invoice Cancellation%'
                OR event_name LIKE '%Create Memo Cancellation%'
                OR event_name LIKE '%Post Credit Memo%'
                OR event_name LIKE '%Post Reverse Invoice%'
                OR event_name LIKE '%Post Incoming Payment%'
                OR event_name LIKE '%Post Invoice%'                
                OR event_name LIKE '%Clear Invoice%'
            AND "EventCreatedByUserType" IS NOT NULL
        )
    )
  ) * 100
FROM
  THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Automation Rate of Outbound Delivery
children.description: Automation Percentage of 'Create Outbound Delivery'  event

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  SUM(
    (
      SELECT
        COUNT(case_id) FILTER (
          WHERE
            (
              "EventCreatedByUserType" IN ('System', 'Service')
              AND (event_name LIKE 'Create Outbound Delivery')
            )
        )
    )
  ) / SUM(
    (
      SELECT
        COUNT(case_id) FILTER (
          WHERE
            event_name LIKE 'Create Outbound Delivery'
            AND "EventCreatedByUserType" IS NOT NULL
        )
    )
  ) * 100
FROM
  THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Automation Rate of Sales Order Creation Events
children.description: Automation Percentage of  'Create Sales Order Item' event

children.name: Automation Rate Overall
children.description: Percentage of all events performed by System or as an automated Service

children.name: Automation Rate grouped by Company Code Name
children.description: Automation rate grouped by Company Code Name - Top 20

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  SUM(
    (
      SELECT
        COUNT (EVENT_NAME) FILTER (
          WHERE
            ("EventCreatedByUserType" IN ('System', 'Service'))
        )
    )
  ) / SUM (
    (
      SELECT
        COUNT (EVENT_NAME) FILTER (
          WHERE
            ("EventCreatedByUserType" IS NOT NULL)
        )
    )
  ) * 100 AS "Automation rate in %",
  "InvoiceCompanyCode" AS "Company Name"
FROM
  THIS_PROCESS
WHERE
  "InvoiceCompanyCode" IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY
  1 DESC NULLS LAST
LIMIT
  20

children.name: Number of Automated vs Manual Events sorted by Event Frequency
children.description: The overview shows how often an event was performed manually and automated

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  COUNT(event_name) AS "Cases",
  "event_name" AS "Event Name",
  CASE
    WHEN "EventCreatedByUserType" = 'Dialog' THEN 'Manual'
    WHEN "EventCreatedByUserType" IN ('System', 'Service') THEN 'Automated'
    ELSE 'undefined'
  END AS "Automation"
FROM
  FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS)
WHERE
  "EventCreatedByUserType" IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY
  2,
  3
ORDER BY
  1 DESC NULLS LAST
LIMIT
  25

children.name: Total Number of Events
children.description: Number of events in the data set

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  COUNT(event_name)
FROM
  FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS)

children.name: Automation per Individual Event
children.description: The table shows an overview of individual Events and their number of manual and automated performance

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  event_name AS "Event Name",
  COUNT(DISTINCT case_id) AS "# of Cases",
  COUNT(event_name) AS "# of Events",
  COUNT(event_name) FILTER(
    WHERE
      "EventCreatedByUserType" IN ('Dialog')
  ) AS "# of Manual Events",
  COUNT(event_name) FILTER(
    WHERE
      "EventCreatedByUserType" IN ('System', 'Service')
  ) AS "# of Automated Events",
  COUNT(event_name) FILTER (
    WHERE
      "EventCreatedByUserType" IN ('System', 'Service')
  ) / COUNT("event_name") FILTER (
          WHERE
            "EventCreatedByUserType" IS NOT NULL) 
            * 100 AS "Automation Rate in %"
FROM
  FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS)
WHERE
  "EventCreatedByUserType" IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY
  3 DESC

children.name: Most active RPA Bots (Automation Users)
children.description: The table shows the frequency of Invoice Events of non-dialogue users. It is recommended to map RPA bot names / automation users to their official name instead of pseudonymizing them

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  "EventCreatedByUserId",
  event_name AS "Event Name",
  COUNT(case_id) AS "# of Cases",
  COUNT(event_name) AS "# of Events"
FROM
  FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS)
WHERE
  "EventCreatedByUserType" != 'Dialog' AND "EventCreatedByUserType" IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY
  4 DESC

children.name: Automation Rate grouped by Plant
children.description: Automation rate grouped by Plant - Top 20

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  SUM (
    (
      SELECT
        COUNT (EVENT_NAME) FILTER (
          WHERE
            ("EventCreatedByUserType" IN ('System', 'Service'))
        )
    )
  ) / SUM (
    (
      SELECT
        COUNT (EVENT_NAME) FILTER (
          WHERE
            "EventCreatedByUserType" IS NOT NULL
        )
    )
  ) * 100 AS "Automation rate in %",
  "SalesDocItemPlant" AS "Plant"
FROM
  THIS_PROCESS
WHERE
  "SalesDocItemPlant" IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY
  1 DESC NULLS LAST
LIMIT
  20

children.name: Automated Events grouped by Company over Time
children.description: Automated events based on occurrence over time per Company Code Name

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  DATE_TRUNC(
    'month',
    (
      SELECT
        FIRST (end_time) FILTER (
          WHERE
            EVENT_NAME IN ('Post Invoice')
        )
    )
  ) AS "Event Date",
  (
    SUM (
      (
        SELECT
          COUNT (EVENT_NAME) FILTER (
            WHERE
              (
                "EventCreatedByUserType" IN ('System', 'Service')
              )
          )
      )
    ) / SUM(
      (
        SELECT
          COUNT (EVENT_NAME) FILTER (
            WHERE
              "EventCreatedByUserType" IS NOT NULL
          )
      )
    ) * 100
  ) AS "Percentage of Automated Events",
  "InvoiceCompanyCode" AS "Company"
FROM
  THIS_PROCESS
WHERE
  "InvoiceCompanyCode" IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY
  1 ASC NULLS FIRST FILL TIMESERIES('MONTH'),
  NULL

children.name: Number of Automated Events
children.description: Number of all events performed by System or as an automated Service

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  COUNT(event_name) FILTER(
    WHERE
("EventCreatedByUserType" IN ('System', 'Service'))
  )
FROM
  FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS)

children.name: Automation per Business Object
children.description: The table shows an overview of manual and automated Events per event group

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  CASE
    WHEN event_name LIKE '%Quotation%' THEN 'Quotation Item'
    WHEN event_name LIKE 'Sales Order%' THEN 'SO Events'
    WHEN event_name LIKE '%Invoice%'
    OR event_name LIKE '%Memo%' THEN 'Invoice Events'
    WHEN event_name LIKE '%GR%'
    OR event_name LIKE '%Quality%'
    OR event_name LIKE '%Goods Receipt%' THEN 'Goods Receipt'
    WHEN event_name LIKE '%Change%'
    OR event_name LIKE '%Update%'
    OR event_name LIKE '%Set%'
    OR event_name LIKE '%Remove%' THEN 'Change Events'
    ELSE event_name
  END AS "Group of Events",
  COUNT(DISTINCT case_id) AS "# of Cases",
  COUNT(event_name) AS "# of Events",
  COUNT(event_name) FILTER(
    WHERE
      "EventCreatedByUserType" IN ('Dialog')
  ) AS "# of Manual Events",
  COUNT(event_name) FILTER (
    WHERE
      "EventCreatedByUserType" IN ('System', 'Service')
  ) / COUNT("event_name")  FILTER (
          WHERE
            "EventCreatedByUserType" IS NOT NULL) * 100 AS "Automation Rate in %"
FROM
  FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS)
WHERE
  "EventCreatedByUserType" IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY
  3 DESC

blocks.text: On this page, you can deep dive into the impact of changes on your organization and get the first insights for taking action.

children.name: Automation Rate per Case
children.description: The overview shows automation rate per case grouped by bucket

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  BUCKET("Automation Rate",0,10,10)*10 AS "Automation rate in %",
  count(case_id) AS "Cases"
FROM (
  SELECT 
    case_id,
    (SELECT COUNT(event_name) FILTER (
    	  WHERE 
            "EventCreatedByUserType" IN ('System', 'Service'))
          / COUNT(event_name) FILTER (
          WHERE
            "EventCreatedByUserType" IS NOT NULL)
    ) * 100 AS "Automation Rate"
FROM THIS_PROCESS) as sub
WHERE "Automation Rate" IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY 1

children.name: Automated Posting Events grouped by Sales Document Category over Time
children.description: Percentage of automated Posting Events based on "SalesDocItemCategory"

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  DATE_TRUNC(
    'month',
    (
      SELECT
        FIRST (end_time) FILTER (
          WHERE
            EVENT_NAME IN ('Post Invoice')
        )
    )
  ) AS "Invoice Posting Date",
  (
    SUM (
      (
        SELECT
          COUNT (EVENT_NAME) FILTER (
            WHERE
              EVENT_NAME = 'Post Invoice'
              AND (
                "EventCreatedByUserType" IN ('System', 'Service')
              )
          )
      )
    ) / SUM(
      (
        SELECT
          COUNT (EVENT_NAME) FILTER (
            WHERE
              EVENT_NAME = 'Post Invoice'
              AND "EventCreatedByUserType" IS NOT NULL
          )
      )
    ) * 100
  ) AS "Percentage of Automated Events",
  "SalesDocItemCategory" AS "Sales Document Category"
FROM
  THIS_PROCESS
WHERE
  "InvoiceCompanyCode" IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY
  1 ASC NULLS FIRST FILL TIMESERIES('MONTH'),
  NULL

children.name: Automation Rate of Invoice Creation
children.description: Automation rate for 'Create Invoice' event

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  COUNT("event_name") FILTER (
    WHERE
      BEHAVIOR (
        "EventCreatedByUserType" IN ('System', 'Service')
        AND (
          event_name LIKE '%Create Invoice%'
          OR event_name LIKE '%Create Pro Forma Invoice%'
          OR event_name LIKE '%Create Credit Memo%'
          OR event_name LIKE '%Create Debit Memo%'
          OR event_name LIKE '%Create Invoice Cancellation%'
          OR event_name LIKE '%Create Memo Cancellation%'
          OR event_name LIKE '%Post Credit Memo%'
          OR event_name LIKE '%Post Reverse Invoice%'
          OR event_name LIKE '%Post Incoming Payment%'
          OR event_name LIKE '%Post Invoice%'
          OR event_name LIKE '%Clear Invoice%'
        )
      ) AS automated MATCHES (automated)
  ) / COUNT("event_name") FILTER (
          WHERE
            "EventCreatedByUserType" IS NOT NULL) * 100
FROM
  FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS)
WHERE
  (
    event_name LIKE '%Create Invoice%'
    OR event_name LIKE '%Create Pro Forma Invoice%'
    OR event_name LIKE '%Create Credit Memo%'
    OR event_name LIKE '%Create Debit Memo%'
    OR event_name LIKE '%Create Invoice Cancellation%'
    OR event_name LIKE '%Create Memo Cancellation%'
    OR event_name LIKE '%Post Credit Memo%'
    OR event_name LIKE '%Post Reverse Invoice%'
    OR event_name LIKE '%Post Incoming Payment%'
    OR event_name LIKE '%Post Invoice%'
    OR event_name LIKE '%Clear Invoice%'
  )

children.name: Automation Rate of Invoice Creation over Time
children.description: Percentage of Automation for Invoice Creation event

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  DATE_TRUNC('month', end_time) AS "Invoice Creation Date",
  COUNT ("event_name") FILTER (
    WHERE
      BEHAVIOUR (
        "EventCreatedByUserType" IN ('System', 'Service')
        AND (EVENT_NAME LIKE 'Create Invoice%')
      ) AS automated MATCHES (automated)
  ) / COUNT ("event_name") FILTER (
          WHERE

FROM
  FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS)
WHERE
  (EVENT_NAME LIKE 'Create Invoice%')
ORDER BY
  1 ASC NULLS FIRST FILL TIMESERIES('month'),
  NULL

dataSource.query:
SELECT

  COUNT ("event_name") FILTER (
    WHERE
      BEHAVIOUR (
        "EventCreatedByUserType" IN ('System', 'Service')
        AND (EVENT_NAME LIKE 'Clear%')

WHERE

children.name: Automation Rate of Quotation Creation over Time
children.description: Percentage of Automation for Quotation Creation

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  DATE_TRUNC('month', end_time) AS "Quotation Creation Date",
  COUNT ("event_name") FILTER (
    WHERE
      BEHAVIOUR (
        "EventCreatedByUserType" IN ('System', 'Service')
        AND (EVENT_NAME LIKE 'Create Quotation Item')
      ) AS created_with_dialog MATCHES (created_with_dialog)
  ) / COUNT ("event_name") FILTER (
          WHERE
            "EventCreatedByUserType" IS NOT NULL) * 100 AS "Automation Rate"
FROM
  FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS)
WHERE
  (EVENT_NAME LIKE 'Create Quotation Item')
ORDER BY
  1 ASC NULLS FIRST FILL TIMESERIES('month'),
  NULL

children.name: Automation of Labor Costs
children.description: The table shows an overview of manual and automated events of labor costs related events

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  event_name AS "Event Name",
  COUNT(DISTINCT case_id) AS "# of Cases",
  COUNT(event_name) AS "# of Events",
  COUNT(event_name) FILTER(
    WHERE
      "EventCreatedByUserType" IN ('Dialog')
  ) AS "# of Manual Events",
  COUNT(event_name) FILTER(
    WHERE
      "EventCreatedByUserType" IN ('System', 'Service')
  ) AS "# of Automated Events",
  COUNT(event_name) FILTER (
    WHERE
      "EventCreatedByUserType" IN ('System', 'Service')
  ) / COUNT("event_name") FILTER (
          WHERE
            "EventCreatedByUserType" IS NOT NULL) * 100   AS "Automation Rate in %",
  SUM("InvoiceItemTotalNetAmountCurrConverted") AS "Total Invoice Net Amount Converted"
FROM
  FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS)
WHERE
  "EventCreatedByUserType" IS NOT NULL
  AND event_name LIKE 'Post Goods Issue'
  OR event_name LIKE 'Credit Check Passed'
  OR event_name LIKE 'Create Invoice'
  OR event_name LIKE 'Create Sales Order Item'
  OR event_name LIKE 'Credit Check Failed'
  OR event_name LIKE 'Sales Order Confirmed'
  OR event_name LIKE 'Sales Order Completely Processed'
  OR event_name LIKE 'Set Sales Doc Delivery Block'
ORDER BY
  3 DESC

children.name: Number of Clearing Events
children.description: Total number of clearing events in data set

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  COUNT("event_name") FILTER (
    WHERE
      BEHAVIOR (
        event_name LIKE 'Clear%'
      ) AS created_with_dialog MATCHES (created_with_dialog)
  )
FROM
  FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS)

children.name: Number of Invoices Created
children.description: Total number of Invoices and Pro Forma Invoices created

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  COUNT("event_name") FILTER (
    WHERE
      BEHAVIOR (
        event_name LIKE 'Create Invoice%'
        OR event_name = 'Create Pro Forma Invoice%'
      ) AS created_with_dialog MATCHES (created_with_dialog)
  )
FROM
  FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS)

blocks.text: The following section gives a deep dive into the automation of Invoice creation events.

children.name: Automation Rate for Invoice Posting grouped by Sales Document Type
children.description: Automation rate by Sales Document Type - Top 20

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  SUM (
    (
      SELECT
        COUNT (EVENT_NAME) FILTER (
          WHERE
            (
              "EventCreatedByUserType" IN ('System', 'Service')
              AND event_name = 'Post Invoice'
              OR event_name = 'Post Credit Memo'
              OR event_name = 'Payment Posting'
            )
        )
    )
  ) / SUM (
    (
      SELECT
        COUNT (EVENT_NAME) FILTER (
          WHERE
            "EventCreatedByUserType" IS NOT NULL
            AND event_name = 'Post Invoice'
            OR event_name = 'Post Credit Memo'
            OR event_name = 'Payment Posting'
        )
    )
  ) * 100 AS "Automation rate in %"
,
  "SalesDocType" AS "Sales Document Type"
FROM
  THIS_PROCESS
WHERE
  "SalesDocType" IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY
  1 DESC NULLS LAST
LIMIT
  20

blocks.text: The following section gives a deep dive into the automation of Sales Order Items creation events.
The purpose of this page is to drill down into the potential root causes of bad performance identified on the previous page.

children.name: Number of Sales Order Created
children.description: Total number of Sales Orders created

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  COUNT ("case_id") FILTER (
    WHERE
      BEHAVIOR (
        event_name LIKE 'Create Sales Order Item%'
      ) AS created MATCHES (created)
  )
FROM
  FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS)

children.name: Automation Rate of Sales Order Creation
children.description: Automation rate for 'Create Sales Order Item' event

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  COUNT("event_name") FILTER (
    WHERE
      BEHAVIOR (
        "EventCreatedByUserType" IN ('System', 'Service')
        AND (event_name LIKE 'Create Sales Order Item%')
      ) AS automated MATCHES (automated)
  ) / COUNT("event_name") FILTER (
          WHERE
            "EventCreatedByUserType" IS NOT NULL) * 100
FROM
  FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS)
WHERE
  (event_name LIKE 'Create Sales Order Item%')

children.name: Automation Rate of Sales Order Creation over Time
children.description: Percentage of Automation for Sales Orders Creation

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  DATE_TRUNC('month', end_time) AS "Sales Order Item Creation Date",
  COUNT ("event_name") FILTER (
    WHERE
      BEHAVIOUR (
        "EventCreatedByUserType" IN ('System', 'Service')
        AND (EVENT_NAME LIKE 'Create Sales Order Item%')
      ) AS automated MATCHES (automated)
  ) / COUNT ("event_name")  FILTER (
          WHERE
            "EventCreatedByUserType" IS NOT NULL) * 100 AS "Automation Rate"
FROM
  FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS)
WHERE
  (EVENT_NAME LIKE 'Create Sales Order Item%')
ORDER BY
  1 ASC NULLS FIRST FILL TIMESERIES('month'),
  NULL

children.name: Number of Quotation Created

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  DISTINCT COUNT ("case_id") FILTER (
    WHERE
      BEHAVIOR (
        event_name LIKE 'Create Quotation Item%'
      ) AS created MATCHES (created)
  )
FROM
  FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS)

children.name: Action Recommendations (Links are marked in blue)
children.description: Please find recommendations behind the links  (marked in blue)

blocks.text: Sales Order:
Automation Execution: Discover and run automation, and get information about automation runs.
Sales Order from Excel: Automate extraction of sales order request and creation of sales orders in the SAP S/4HANA system.
Sales Order from Unstructured Data: Automate creation of sales order requests from unstructured data and sales orders from excel file.
Manage Sales Order: Automate and manage approvals of Sales Orders in the SAP S/4HANA system.
SAP Business Accelerator Hub: Gain real-time process visibility and insight-to-action in your procurement operations.
Outbound Delivery:
Outbound Delivery Creation: Automate creation of an outbound delivery with reference of a sales order.
Post Goods Issue: Automate post goods issue for all outbound deliveries in SAP S/4HANA.
Delivery and Billing Block: Automate delivery and billing block in sales order using SAP Build Process Automation or SAP Workflow Management.
Invoice:
Approval and Creation: Automate and manage the approvals and creation of sales orders in SAP ERP with approvals performed in SAP Workflow Management or SAP Build Process Automation.
Customer Refund Request: Automate customer refund request using automatic/manual decisions in SAP SAP S/4HANA.

children.name: Recommendations for action based on sub-process events and their rates of automation
children.description: The table calculates all automated events as rate per business object to provide improvement recommendations

children.name: Focus Areas for Automation Potential
children.description: This table shows the most frequent transitions between events or states. It allows a focus on flows of events with a high average lead time, which are interesting for automation.

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  Event_Name AS "Event Name",
  "Following event",
  COUNT(Event_Name) AS "Occurence",
  COUNT(event_name) FILTER(
    WHERE
      "EventCreatedByUserType" IN ('System', 'Service')
  ) / COUNT("event_name") FILTER (
          WHERE
            "EventCreatedByUserType" IS NOT NULL) * 100 AS "Automation Rate in %",
  AVG(Event_Cycle_Time) AS "AVG Lead Time",
  MIN(Event_Cycle_Time) AS "MIN Lead Time",
  MAX(Event_Cycle_Time) AS "MAX Lead Time"
FROM
  (
    SELECT
      Event_Name,
      LEAD(Event_Name) OVER () AS "Following event",
      LEAD(End_Time) OVER (PARTITION BY Case_Id) - End_Time AS Event_Cycle_Time,
      "EventCreatedByUserType"
    FROM
      FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS)
  ) AS sub_query_Event_Cycle_Time
WHERE
  "EventCreatedByUserType" IS NOT NULL
  AND event_name NOT LIKE '%Due Date%'
  AND event_name NOT LIKE '%Vendor%'
  AND "Following event" NOT LIKE '%Due Date%'
  AND "Following event" NOT LIKE '%Vendor%'
  AND Event_name <> "Following event"
GROUP BY
  1,
  2
ORDER BY
  3 DESC

children.name: Case Details
children.description: The table shows all cases including important Details to be considered for Automation purposes

dataSource.query:
SELECT
   case_id,
  "SalesDocId",
  "InvoiceCompanyCode" AS "Company Code Name",
  "SalesDocSalesOrganization",
   event_name AS "Name of Event",
  "EventCreatedByUserId" AS "Involved Users",
  "EventCreatedByUserType" AS "User Type",
(
    SELECT
      LAST(end_time) FILTER (
        WHERE
          event_name IN (
            'Create Sales Order Item',
            'Create Quotation Item',
            'Create Contract Item'
          )
      )
  ) AS "SD Creation Date",
  "SalesDocType",
  "SalesDocItemQuantityOrdered",
  "SalesDocItemQuantityConfirmed",
  "DeliveryTotalQuantityDelivered",
  "LastDeliveryGoodsMovementOnTime" AS "On Time",
CASE
    WHEN "SalesDocItemQuantityConfirmed" = "DeliveryTotalQuantityDelivered" THEN 'Yes'
    WHEN "SalesDocItemQuantityConfirmed" < "DeliveryTotalQuantityDelivered" THEN 'Overdelivery'
    WHEN "SalesDocItemQuantityConfirmed" > "DeliveryTotalQuantityDelivered" THEN 'No'
  END AS "In Full",
  "SalesDocItemNetValue",
  "SalesDocCustomerCompany",
  "SalesDocCustomerCountry",
  "SalesDocItemMaterialGroup",
  "SalesDocItemMaterial",
  "SalesDocLastConfirmedDeliveryDate",
  "SalesDocPlannedShipmentDate",
  "LastDeliveryWarehouse",
  SUM(
    (
      SELECT
        COUNT(event_name) FILTER (
          WHERE
            (
              "EventCreatedByUserType" IN ('System', 'Service')
            )
        )
    )
  ) / SUM(
    (
      SELECT
        COUNT(event_name) FILTER (
          WHERE
("EventCreatedByUserType" IS NOT NULL)
        )
    )
  ) * 100 AS "Automation Rate"
FROM
  THIS_PROCESS
  ORDER BY 1 DESC
